description.para: This parameter activates/deactivates Location Lock feature on BTS.

shortDesc.para: This parameter activates/deactivates Location Lock feature on BTS.

description.para: If BTSSCL::actLocationLock is set to 'true', then the BTSSCL::locationLockConf structure must be configured.
If BTSSCL::actLocationLock is set to 'true', then the value of BTSSCL::locationLockConf::detectionMethods parameter must be different than zero.

If BTSSCL::actLocationLock is set to 'true' AND BTSSCL::gpsInUse is set to 'false' then BTSSCL::locationLockConf::detectionMethods::GNSS bit must be set to zero i.e. detectionMethods cannot get value 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13 or 15.

The date and time are expressed in the NE's local time in the format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSS[+-]hh:mm" where "hh:mm" is the offset from GMT.

description.para: 01.12.2014 LCh: CRL4328 Add SW Build Info to Configuration Parameters

The alarms are suppressed based on the toggling alarm parameters. The toggling alarm parameters contain the amount of alarms in time (time and amount values ) for setting the toggling alarm condition and clearance duration time when the toggling alarm is no longer toggling (alarm either active or cleared). If the alarm is active, it is set active after toggling alarm is cleared.

shortDesc.para: The alarms are suppressed based on the toggling alarm parameters.

BTS Fault name defined in RISE. The same name can be found in the BTS alarm documentation. This parameter includes also alarming resource and fault ID. Syntax used in enums: hw_faultId_faultName. NOTE: There are some special marks indicating usually dynamic part in the fault name. Special marks are removed in PDDB but they are visible for the operator.

This parameter specifies the synchronization mode of the eNB.

In phase synchronised mode, the radio interface signal is frequency synchronised and in addition the start of the frames on the radio interface is phase synchronised. Phase sync mode must always be configured in TDD systems. Phase sync requires sync input either from GPS or ToP-P.

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the synchronization mode of the eNB.

description.para: If btsSyncMode is set to 'PhaseSync', at least one of the sync reference sources must be configured which are capable of providing phase synchronisation. The only allowable transport reference source is Timing over Packet with Phase Sync.
If actToPPhaseSynch is set to 'true', btsSyncMode shall be set to 'PhaseSync'.
If btsSyncMode is set to 'PhaseSync' and an external GPS receiver is used, either gnssCableLength or gnssLineDelay shall be configured.
If btsSyncMode is set to 'PhaseSync' and an internal GPS receiver is used, gnssLineDelay shall be configured.
If btsSyncMode is set to 'PhaseSync' and a Sync Hub Master is used, totalDelayFromSHM shall be configured.
If btsSyncMode is set to 'PhaseSync'
- holdOverModeUsed is allowed to be set to 'true'
- ppsTimingOffset ppsTimingOffset can be used
- actOtdoa is allowed to be set to 'true.
- actHybridSync is allowed to be set to 'true'.
Please note: actTopPhaseSynch and actHybridSync are configured in the transport domain and there is no parameter validation between the transport and radio domains.

feature.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

description.para: This parameter sets the next date of the GLONASS leap second or the previous date of the GLONASS leap second if the next GLONASS leap second has not been announced.
The format is:
YYYY-MM-DD
This parameter must be set if GNSS Control Mode parameter is set to GLONASS only.

shortDesc.para: This parameter sets the next date of the GLONASS leap second or the previous date of the GLONASS leap second if the next GLONASS leap second has not been announced.
The format is:
YYYY-MM-DD

description.para: glonassLeapSecondDate is only required for one of the following conditions:
1. GNSSE/gnssControlMode = GLONASS only
2. GNSSI/gnssControlMode = GLONASS only
if glonassLeapSecondDate set to a valid date string then:
1. glonassOffsetAfter must be set to a valid integer value
2. glonassOffsetBefore must be set to a valid integer value

This parameter must be set if GNSS Control Mode parameter is set to GLONASS only.

This parameter is used to control LED visibility.
When it is set to -1, LED will be OFF;
When it is set to 0, LED will be always ON;
When it is set to 1..720, LED will be ON for the time duration (in minutes)specified following power cycle or BTS reset.

shortDesc.para: This parameter is used to control LED visibility.
When it is set to -1, LED will be OFF;
When it is set to 0, LED will be always ON;
When it is set to 1..720, LED will be ON for the time duration (in minutes) specified following power cycle or BTS reset.

additionalInfo.para: the parameter has been added to the unified module, but its related to FZM discrete model definition only, SW definitin in Macro doesn't know the parameter at all

This parameter configures the reporting period (hours) of Location Lock violation alarm.
A value of 0 indicates that an alarm will only be generated once on detection of the Location Lock violation.

shortDesc.para: This parameter configures the reporting period (hours) of Location Lock violation alarm.

special.text: Report alarm only once on Location Lock violation

description.para: This parameter activates/deactivates automatic BTS disable on Location Lock violation detection.

shortDesc.para: This parameter activates/deactivates automatic BTS disable on Location Lock violation detection.

description.para: Do not disable BTS automatically on location lock violation.
This parameter configures one or more detection methods for Location Lock feature (multiple choice selection).
Bitmask with bits defined as follows:
0 - GNSS (use GPS/GLONASS);
1 - netRouting (use routing tables);
2 - netLocalAddresses (use local eNB IP addresses);
3 - netGatewayMAC (use gateway MAC address);

shortDesc.para: This parameter configures one or more detection methods for Location Lock feature (multiple choice selection).

description.para: This parameter defines the distance (meters) from recorded GPS/GLONASS position that triggers Location Lock violation.

shortDesc.para: This parameter defines the distance (meters) from recorded GPS/GLONASS position that triggers Location Lock violation.

description.para: Different systems could have difference in the frame synchronization to GPS PPS timing pulse.
This parameter gives possiblity to adjust freely an air interface timing as for 1PPS synchronization pulse.

shortDesc.para: Defines the shift for air frame phase towards the 1PPS.

additionalInfo.para: Parameter value is giving as microseconds.

p.name: disableSCellPDCCHOlLa
p.fullName: Disable PDCCH outer loop link adaptation in SCell

description.para: The parameter controls if PDCCH outer loop link adaptation shall be disabled in SCell for a UE with an activated SCell.

shortDesc.para: The parameter controls if PDCCH outer loop link adaptation shall be disabled in SCell for a UE with an activated SCell.

additionalInfo.para: If disableSCellPDCCHOlLa is set to true, PDCCH OLLA will be disabled for a UE with an active SCell in its SCell (other UEs in this cell which do not have SCell activated/configured can use PDCCH OLLA depending on the setting of actOlLaPdcch in this cell).

If actOlLaPdcch in PCell and SCell is 'true' and disableSCellPDCCHOlLa is set to false, PDCCH OlLa in the SCell will be used for the UE with an active SCell and it will reuse the calculations of the PDCCH OlLa in the PCell of this UE.
If actOlLaPdcch in PCell or SCell is configured to 'false', PDCCH OlLa in SCell is never used and the configured value of disableSCellPDCCHOlLa is not considered by BTS SW.
The parameter shall be set to 'false' when it is expected that there is some correlation between pdcchCqiShift(t) in the pair of cells that are aggregated and it shall be set to 'true' otherwise.
